1049class CouplesBSplineBorder:
1050    
1051    def __init__(self, spline1_inds, spline2_inds, axes1, axes2, front_sides1, front_sides2, transpose_2_to_1, flip_2_to_1, NPa):
1052        self.spline1_inds = spline1_inds
1053        self.spline2_inds = spline2_inds
1054        self.axes1 = axes1
1055        self.axes2 = axes2
1056        self.front_sides1 = front_sides1
1057        self.front_sides2 = front_sides2
1058        self.transpose_2_to_1 = transpose_2_to_1
1059        self.flip_2_to_1 = flip_2_to_1
1060        self.NPa = NPa
1061        self.nb_couples = self.flip_2_to_1.shape[0]
1062    
1063    @classmethod
1064    def extract_border_pts(cls, field, axis, front_side, field_dim=1, offset=0):
1065        npa = field.ndim - field_dim
1066        base_face = np.hstack((np.arange(axis + 1, npa), np.arange(axis)))
1067        if not front_side:
1068            base_face = base_face[::-1]
1069        border_field = field.transpose(axis + field_dim, *np.arange(field_dim), *(base_face + field_dim))[(-(1 + offset) if front_side else offset)]
1070        return border_field
1071    
1072    @classmethod
1073    def extract_border_spline(cls, spline, axis, front_side):
1074        base_face = np.hstack((np.arange(axis + 1, spline.NPa), np.arange(axis)))
1075        if not front_side:
1076            base_face = base_face[::-1]
1077        degrees = spline.getDegrees()
1078        knots = spline.getKnots()
1079        border_degrees = [degrees[i] for i in base_face]
1080        border_knots = [knots[i] for i in base_face]
1081        border_spline = BSpline(border_degrees, border_knots)
1082        return border_spline
1083    
1084    @classmethod
1085    def transpose_and_flip(cls, field, transpose, flip, field_dim=1):
1086        field = field.transpose(*np.arange(field_dim), *(transpose + field_dim))
1087        for i in range(flip.size):
1088            if flip[i]:
1089                field = np.flip(field, axis=(i + field_dim))
1090        return field
1091    
1092    @classmethod
1093    def transpose_and_flip_knots(cls, knots, spans, transpose, flip):
1094        new_knots = []
1095        for i in range(flip.size):
1096            if flip[i]:
1097                new_knots.append(sum(spans[i]) - knots[transpose[i]][::-1])
1098            else:
1099                new_knots.append(knots[transpose[i]])
1100        return new_knots
1101    
1102    @classmethod
1103    def transpose_and_flip_back_knots(cls, knots, spans, transpose, flip):
1104        transpose_back = np.argsort(transpose)
1105        flip_back = flip[transpose_back]
1106        return cls.transpose_and_flip_knots(knots, spans, transpose_back, flip_back)
1107    
1108    @classmethod
1109    def transpose_and_flip_spline(cls, spline, transpose, flip):
1110        spans = spline.getSpans()
1111        knots = spline.getKnots()
1112        degrees = spline.getDegrees()
1113        for i in range(flip.size):
1114            p = degrees[transpose[i]]
1115            knot = knots[transpose[i]]
1116            if flip[i]:
1117                knot = sum(spans[i]) - knot[::-1]
1118            spline.bases[i] = BSplineBasis(p, knot)
1119        return spline
1120    
1121    @classmethod
1122    def from_splines(cls, separated_ctrl_pts, splines):
1123        NPa = splines[0].NPa
1124        assert np.all([sp.NPa==NPa for sp in splines]), "Every patch should have the same parametric space dimension !"
1125        NPh = separated_ctrl_pts[0].shape[0]
1126        assert np.all([ctrl_pts.shape[0]==NPh for ctrl_pts in separated_ctrl_pts]), "Every patch should have the same physical space dimension !"
1127        npatch = len(splines)
1128        all_flip = np.unpackbits(np.arange(2**(NPa - 1), dtype='uint8')[:, None], axis=1, count=(NPa - 1 - 8), bitorder='little')[:, ::-1].astype('bool')
1129        all_transpose = np.array(list(permutations(np.arange(NPa - 1))))
1130        spline1_inds = []
1131        spline2_inds = []
1132        axes1 = []
1133        axes2 = []
1134        front_sides1 = []
1135        front_sides2 = []
1136        transpose_2_to_1 = []
1137        flip_2_to_1 = []
1138        for spline1_ind in range(npatch):
1139            spline1 = splines[spline1_ind]
1140            ctrl_pts1 = separated_ctrl_pts[spline1_ind]
1141            # print(f"sp1 {spline1_ind}")
1142            for spline2_ind in range(spline1_ind + 1, npatch):
1143                spline2 = splines[spline2_ind]
1144                ctrl_pts2 = separated_ctrl_pts[spline2_ind]
1145                # print(f"|sp2 {spline2_ind}")
1146                for axis1 in range(spline1.NPa):
1147                    degrees1 = np.hstack((spline1.getDegrees()[(axis1 + 1):], spline1.getDegrees()[:axis1]))
1148                    knots1 = spline1.getKnots()[(axis1 + 1):] + spline1.getKnots()[:axis1]
1149                    # print(f"||ax1 {axis1}")
1150                    for axis2 in range(spline2.NPa):
1151                        degrees2 = np.hstack((spline2.getDegrees()[(axis2 + 1):], spline2.getDegrees()[:axis2]))
1152                        knots2 = spline2.getKnots()[(axis2 + 1):] + spline2.getKnots()[:axis2]
1153                        spans2 = spline2.getSpans()[(axis2 + 1):] + spline2.getSpans()[:axis2]
1154                        # print(f"|||ax2 {axis2}")
1155                        for front_side1 in [False, True]:
1156                            pts1 = cls.extract_border_pts(ctrl_pts1, axis1, front_side1)
1157                            # print(f"||||{'front' if front_side1 else 'back '} side1")
1158                            for front_side2 in [False, True]:
1159                                pts2 = cls.extract_border_pts(ctrl_pts2, axis2, front_side2)
1160                                # print(f"|||||{'front' if front_side2 else 'back '} side2")
1161                                for transpose in all_transpose:
1162                                    # print(f"||||||transpose {transpose}")
1163                                    if (degrees1==[degrees2[i] for i in transpose]).all():
1164                                        # print(f"||||||same degrees {degrees1}")
1165                                        if list(pts1.shape[1:])==[pts2.shape[1:][i] for i in transpose]:
1166                                            # print(f"||||||same shapes {pts1.shape[1:]}")
1167                                            if np.all([knots1[i].size==knots2[transpose[i]].size for i in range(NPa - 1)]):
1168                                                # print(f"||||||same knots sizes {[knots1[i].size for i in range(NPa - 1)]}")
1169                                                for flip in all_flip:
1170                                                    # print(f"|||||||flip {flip}")
1171                                                    if np.all([(k1==k2).all() for k1, k2 in zip(knots1, cls.transpose_and_flip_knots(knots2, spans2, transpose, flip))]):
1172                                                        # print(f"|||||||same knots {knots1}")
1173                                                        pts2_turned = cls.transpose_and_flip(pts2, transpose, flip)
1174                                                        if np.allclose(pts1, pts2_turned):
1175                                                            # print("_________________GOGOGO_________________")
1176                                                            spline1_inds.append(spline1_ind)
1177                                                            spline2_inds.append(spline2_ind)
1178                                                            axes1.append(axis1)
1179                                                            axes2.append(axis2)
1180                                                            front_sides1.append(front_side1)
1181                                                            front_sides2.append(front_side2)
1182                                                            transpose_2_to_1.append(transpose)
1183                                                            flip_2_to_1.append(flip)
1184        spline1_inds = np.array(spline1_inds, dtype='int')
1185        spline2_inds = np.array(spline2_inds, dtype='int')
1186        axes1 = np.array(axes1, dtype='int')
1187        axes2 = np.array(axes2, dtype='int')
1188        front_sides1 = np.array(front_sides1, dtype='bool')
1189        front_sides2 = np.array(front_sides2, dtype='bool')
1190        transpose_2_to_1 = np.array(transpose_2_to_1, dtype='int')
1191        flip_2_to_1 = np.array(flip_2_to_1, dtype='bool')
1192        return cls(spline1_inds, spline2_inds, axes1, axes2, front_sides1, front_sides2, transpose_2_to_1, flip_2_to_1, NPa)
1193    
1194    def append(self, other):
1195        if self.NPa!=other.NPa: raise ValueError(f"operands could not be concatenated with parametric spaces of dimensions {self.NPa} and {other.NPa}")
1196        self.spline1_inds = np.concatenate((self.spline1_inds, other.spline1_inds), axis=0)
1197        self.spline2_inds = np.concatenate((self.spline2_inds, other.spline2_inds), axis=0)
1198        self.axes1 = np.concatenate((self.axes1, other.axes1), axis=0)
1199        self.axes2 = np.concatenate((self.axes2, other.axes2), axis=0)
1200        self.front_sides1 = np.concatenate((self.front_sides1, other.front_sides1), axis=0)
1201        self.front_sides2 = np.concatenate((self.front_sides2, other.front_sides2), axis=0)
1202        self.transpose_2_to_1 = np.concatenate((self.transpose_2_to_1, other.transpose_2_to_1), axis=0)
1203        self.flip_2_to_1 = np.concatenate((self.flip_2_to_1, other.flip_2_to_1), axis=0)
1204        self.nb_couples += other.nb_couples
1205    
1206    def get_operator_allxi1_to_allxi2(self, spans1, spans2, couple_ind):
1207        ax1 = self.axes1[couple_ind]
1208        ax2 = self.axes2[couple_ind]
1209        front1 = self.front_sides1[couple_ind]
1210        front2 = self.front_sides2[couple_ind]
1211        transpose = self.transpose_2_to_1[couple_ind]
1212        flip = self.flip_2_to_1[couple_ind]
1213        
1214        A = np.zeros((self.NPa, self.NPa), dtype='float')
1215        A[ax2, ax1] = -1 if front1==front2 else 1
1216        arr = np.arange(self.NPa)
1217        j1 = np.hstack((arr[(ax1 + 1):], arr[:ax1]))
1218        j2 = np.hstack((arr[(ax2 + 1):], arr[:ax2]))
1219        A[j2[transpose], j1] = [-1 if f else 1 for f in flip]
1220        b = np.zeros(self.NPa, dtype='float')
1221        b[ax2] = (int(front1) + int(front2))*(1 if front2 else -1)
1222        b[j2[transpose]] = [1 if f else 0 for f in flip]
1223        
1224        alpha1, beta1 = np.array(spans1).T
1225        M1, p1 = np.diag(1/(beta1 - alpha1)), -alpha1/(beta1 - alpha1)
1226        alpha2, beta2 = np.array(spans2).T
1227        M2, p2 = np.diag(beta2 - alpha2), alpha2
1228        b = p2 + M2@b + M2@A@p1
1229        A = M2@A@M1
1230        
1231        return A, b
1232    
1233    def get_connectivity(self, shape_by_patch):
1234        indices = []
1235        start = 0
1236        for shape in shape_by_patch:
1237            end = start + np.prod(shape)
1238            indices.append(np.arange(start, end).reshape(shape))
1239            start = end
1240        nodes_couples = []
1241        for i in range(self.nb_couples):
1242            border_inds1 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(indices[self.spline1_inds[i]], self.axes1[i], self.front_sides1[i], field_dim=0)
1243            border_inds2 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(indices[self.spline2_inds[i]], self.axes2[i], self.front_sides2[i], field_dim=0)
1244            border_inds2_turned_and_fliped = self.__class__.transpose_and_flip(border_inds2, self.transpose_2_to_1[i], self.flip_2_to_1[i], field_dim=0)
1245            nodes_couples.append(np.hstack((border_inds1.reshape((-1, 1)), border_inds2_turned_and_fliped.reshape((-1, 1)))))
1246        if len(nodes_couples)>0:
1247            nodes_couples = np.vstack(nodes_couples)
1248        return MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch)
1249    
1250    def get_borders_couples(self, separated_field, offset=0):
1251        field_dim = separated_field[0].ndim - self.NPa
1252        borders1 = []
1253        borders2_turned_and_fliped = []
1254        for i in range(self.nb_couples):
1255            border1 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(separated_field[self.spline1_inds[i]], self.axes1[i], self.front_sides1[i], offset=offset, field_dim=field_dim)
1256            borders1.append(border1)
1257            border2 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(separated_field[self.spline2_inds[i]], self.axes2[i], self.front_sides2[i], offset=offset, field_dim=field_dim)
1258            border2_turned_and_fliped = self.__class__.transpose_and_flip(border2, self.transpose_2_to_1[i], self.flip_2_to_1[i], field_dim=field_dim)
1259            borders2_turned_and_fliped.append(border2_turned_and_fliped)
1260        return borders1, borders2_turned_and_fliped
1261    
1262    def get_borders_couples_splines(self, splines):
1263        borders1 = []
1264        borders2_turned_and_fliped = []
1265        for i in range(self.nb_couples):
1266            border1 = self.__class__.extract_border_spline(splines[self.spline1_inds[i]], self.axes1[i], self.front_sides1[i])
1267            borders1.append(border1)
1268            border2 = self.__class__.extract_border_spline(splines[self.spline2_inds[i]], self.axes2[i], self.front_sides2[i])
1269            border2_turned_and_fliped = self.__class__.transpose_and_flip_spline(border2, self.transpose_2_to_1[i], self.flip_2_to_1[i])
1270            borders2_turned_and_fliped.append(border2_turned_and_fliped)
1271        return borders1, borders2_turned_and_fliped
1272    
1273    def compute_border_couple_DN(self, couple_ind: int, splines: list[BSpline], XI1_border: list[np.ndarray], k1: list[int]):
1274        spline1 = splines[self.spline1_inds[couple_ind]]
1275        ax1 = self.axes1[couple_ind]
1276        front1 = self.front_sides1[couple_ind]
1277        spline2 = splines[self.spline2_inds[couple_ind]]
1278        ax2 = self.axes2[couple_ind]
1279        front2 = self.front_sides2[couple_ind]
1280        XI1 = XI1_border[(self.NPa - 1 - ax1):] + [np.array([spline1.bases[ax1].span[int(front1)]])] + XI1_border[:(self.NPa - 1 - ax1)]
1281        transpose_back = np.argsort(self.transpose_2_to_1[couple_ind])
1282        flip_back = self.flip_2_to_1[couple_ind][transpose_back]
1283        spans = spline2.getSpans()[(ax2 + 1):] + spline2.getSpans()[:ax2]
1284        XI2_border = [(sum(spans[i]) - XI1_border[transpose_back[i]]) if flip_back[i] else XI1_border[transpose_back[i]] for i in range(self.NPa - 1)]
1285        XI2 = XI2_border[(self.NPa - 1 - ax2):] + [np.array([spline2.bases[ax2].span[int(front2)]])] + XI2_border[:(self.NPa - 1 - ax2)]
1286        k2 = k1[:self.axes1[couple_ind]] + k1[(self.axes1[couple_ind] + 1):]
1287        k2 = [k2[i] for i in transpose_back]
1288        k2 = k2[:self.axes2[couple_ind]] + [k1[self.axes1[couple_ind]]] + k2[self.axes2[couple_ind]:]
1289        DN1 = spline1.DN(XI1, k=k1)
1290        DN2 = spline2.DN(XI2, k=k2)
1291        return DN1, DN2
1292    
1293    def compute_border_couple_DN(self, couple_ind: int, splines: list[BSpline], XI1_border: list[np.ndarray], k1: list[int]):
1294        spline1 = splines[self.spline1_inds[couple_ind]]
1295        spans1 = spline1.getSpans()
1296        ax1 = self.axes1[couple_ind]
1297        front1 = self.front_sides1[couple_ind]
1298        XI1 = XI1_border[(self.NPa - 1 - ax1):] + [np.array([spline1.bases[ax1].span[int(front1)]])] + XI1_border[:(self.NPa - 1 - ax1)]
1299        DN1 = spline1.DN(XI1, k=k1)
1300        
1301        spline2 = splines[self.spline2_inds[couple_ind]]
1302        spans2 = spline2.getSpans()
1303        ax2 = self.axes2[couple_ind]
1304        front2 = self.front_sides2[couple_ind]
1305        transpose = self.transpose_2_to_1[couple_ind]
1306        A, b = self.get_operator_allxi1_to_allxi2(spans1, spans2, couple_ind)
1307        XI2 = []
1308        for i in range(self.NPa):
1309            j = np.argmax(np.abs(A[i]))
1310            XI2.append(A[i, j]*XI1[j] + b[i])
1311        
1312        k = int(sum(k1))
1313        DN2 = spline2.DN(XI2, k=k)
1314        if k!=0:
1315            AT = 1
1316            for i in range(k):
1317                AT = np.tensordot(AT, A, 0)
1318            AT = AT.transpose(*2*np.arange(k), *(2*np.arange(k) + 1))
1319            DN2 = np.tensordot(DN2, AT, k)
1320            i1 = np.repeat(np.arange(self.NPa), k1)
1321            DN2 = DN2[tuple(i1.tolist())]
1322        return DN1, DN2
@nb.njit(cache=True)
def find(parent, x): 
20@nb.njit(cache=True)
21def find(parent, x):
22    if parent[x]!=x:
23        parent[x] = find(parent, parent[x])
24    return parent[x]
@nb.njit(cache=True)
def union(parent, rank, x, y): 
26@nb.njit(cache=True)
27def union(parent, rank, x, y):
28    rootX = find(parent, x)
29    rootY = find(parent, y)
30    if rootX!=rootY:
31        if rank[rootX]>rank[rootY]:
32            parent[rootY] = rootX
33        elif rank[rootX]<rank[rootY]:
34            parent[rootX] = rootY
35        else:
36            parent[rootY] = rootX
37            rank[rootX] += 1
@nb.njit(cache=True)
def get_unique_nodes_inds(nodes_couples, nb_nodes): 
39@nb.njit(cache=True)
40def get_unique_nodes_inds(nodes_couples, nb_nodes):
41    parent = np.arange(nb_nodes)
42    rank = np.zeros(nb_nodes, dtype=np.int32)
43    for a, b in nodes_couples:
44        union(parent, rank, a, b)
45    unique_nodes_inds = np.empty(nb_nodes, dtype=np.int32)
46    for i in range(nb_nodes):
47        unique_nodes_inds[i] = find(parent, i)
48    return unique_nodes_inds
class MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity: 
  50class MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity:
  51    """
  52    Contains all the methods to link multiple B-spline patches.
  53    It uses 3 representations of the data : 
  54      - a unique representation, possibly common with other meshes, containing 
  55        only unique nodes indices, 
  56      - a unpacked representation containing duplicated nodes indices, 
  57      - a separated representation containing duplicated nodes indices, 
  58        separated between patches. It is here for user friendliness.
  59
  60    Attributes
  61    ----------
  62    unique_nodes_inds : numpy.ndarray of int
  63        The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  64    shape_by_patch : numpy.ndarray of int
  65        The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  66    nb_nodes : int
  67        The total number of unpacked nodes.
  68    nb_unique_nodes : int
  69        The total number of unique nodes.
  70    nb_patchs : int
  71        The number of patches.
  72    npa : int
  73        The dimension of the parametric space of the B-splines.
  74    """
  75    unique_nodes_inds: np.ndarray
  76    shape_by_patch: np.ndarray
  77    nb_nodes: int
  78    nb_unique_nodes: int
  79    nb_patchs: int
  80    npa: int
  81    
  82    def __init__(self, unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes):
  83        """
  84
  85        Parameters
  86        ----------
  87        unique_nodes_inds : numpy.ndarray of int
  88            The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  89        shape_by_patch : numpy.ndarray of int
  90            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  91        nb_unique_nodes : int
  92            The total number of unique nodes.
  93        """
  94        self.unique_nodes_inds = unique_nodes_inds
  95        self.shape_by_patch = shape_by_patch
  96        self.nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(self.shape_by_patch, axis=1))
  97        self.nb_unique_nodes = nb_unique_nodes #np.unique(self.unique_nodes_inds).size
  98        self.nb_patchs, self.npa = self.shape_by_patch.shape
  99    
 100    @classmethod
 101    def from_nodes_couples(cls, nodes_couples, shape_by_patch):
 102        """
 103        Create the connectivity from a list of couples of unpacked nodes.
 104
 105        Parameters
 106        ----------
 107        nodes_couples : numpy.ndarray of int
 108            Couples of indices of unpacked nodes that are considered the same.
 109            Its shape should be (# of couples, 2)
 110        shape_by_patch : numpy.ndarray of int
 111            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
 112
 113        Returns
 114        -------
 115        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 116            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
 117        """
 118        nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(shape_by_patch, axis=1))
 119        unique_nodes_inds = get_unique_nodes_inds(nodes_couples, nb_nodes)
 120        different_unique_nodes_inds, inverse = np.unique(unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True)
 121        unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], different_unique_nodes_inds))) - 1)[inverse]
 122        nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(unique_nodes_inds).size
 123        return cls(unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes)
 124    
 125    @classmethod
 126    def from_separated_ctrlPts(cls, separated_ctrlPts, eps=1e-10, return_nodes_couples: bool=False):
 127        """
 128        Create the connectivity from a list of control points given as 
 129        a separated field by comparing every couple of points.
 130
 131        Parameters
 132        ----------
 133        separated_ctrlPts : list of numpy.ndarray of float
 134            Control points of every patch to be compared in the separated 
 135            representation. Every array is of shape : 
 136            (``NPh``, nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim ``npa``)
 137        eps : float, optional
 138            Maximum distance between two points to be considered the same, by default 1e-10
 139        return_nodes_couples : bool, optional
 140            If `True`, returns the `nodes_couples` created, by default False
 141
 142        Returns
 143        -------
 144        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 145            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
 146        """
 147        NPh = separated_ctrlPts[0].shape[0]
 148        assert np.all([ctrlPts.shape[0]==NPh for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts[1:]]), "Physical spaces must contain the same number of dimensions !"
 149        shape_by_patch = np.array([ctrlPts.shape[1:] for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts], dtype='int')
 150        nodes_couples = []
 151        previous_pts = separated_ctrlPts[0].reshape((NPh, -1))
 152        previous_inds_counter = previous_pts.shape[1]
 153        previous_inds = np.arange(previous_inds_counter)
 154        for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts[1:]:
 155            # create current pts and inds
 156            current_pts = ctrlPts.reshape((NPh, -1))
 157            current_inds_counter = previous_inds_counter + current_pts.shape[1]
 158            current_inds = np.arange(previous_inds_counter, current_inds_counter)
 159            # get couples
 160            dist = np.linalg.norm(previous_pts[:, :, None] - current_pts[:, None, :], axis=0)
 161            previous_inds_inds, current_inds_inds = (dist<eps).nonzero()
 162            nodes_couples.append(np.hstack((previous_inds[previous_inds_inds, None], current_inds[current_inds_inds, None])))
 163            # add current to previous for next iteration
 164            previous_pts = np.hstack((previous_pts, current_pts))
 165            previous_inds_counter = current_inds_counter
 166            previous_inds = np.hstack((previous_inds, current_inds))
 167        if len(nodes_couples)>0:
 168            nodes_couples = np.vstack(nodes_couples)
 169        else:
 170            nodes_couples = np.empty((0, 2), dtype='int')
 171        if return_nodes_couples:
 172            return cls.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch), nodes_couples
 173        else:
 174            return cls.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch)
 175    
 176    def unpack(self, unique_field):
 177        """
 178        Extract the unpacked representation from a unique representation.
 179
 180        Parameters
 181        ----------
 182        unique_field : numpy.ndarray
 183            The unique representation. Its shape should be :
 184            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`)
 185
 186        Returns
 187        -------
 188        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
 189            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
 190            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 191        """
 192        unpacked_field = unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds]
 193        return unpacked_field
 194    
 195    def pack(self, unpacked_field, method='mean'):
 196        """
 197        Extract the unique representation from an unpacked representation.
 198
 199        Parameters
 200        ----------
 201        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
 202            The unpacked representation. Its shape should be :
 203            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 204        method: str
 205            The method used to group values that could be different
 206
 207        Returns
 208        -------
 209        unique_nodes : numpy.ndarray
 210            The unique representation. Its shape is :
 211            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`)
 212        """
 213        field_shape = unpacked_field.shape[:-1]
 214        unique_field = np.zeros((*field_shape, self.nb_unique_nodes), dtype=unpacked_field.dtype)
 215        if method=='last':
 216            unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds] = unpacked_field
 217        elif method=='first':
 218            unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds[::-1]] = unpacked_field[..., ::-1]
 219        elif method=='mean':
 220            np.add.at(unique_field.T, self.unique_nodes_inds, unpacked_field.T)
 221            counts = np.zeros(self.nb_unique_nodes, dtype='uint')
 222            np.add.at(counts, self.unique_nodes_inds, 1)
 223            unique_field /= counts
 224        else:
 225            raise NotImplementedError(f"Method {method} is not implemented ! Consider using 'first' or 'mean'.")
 226        return unique_field
 227    
 228    def separate(self, unpacked_field):
 229        """
 230        Extract the separated representation from an unpacked representation.
 231
 232        Parameters
 233        ----------
 234        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
 235            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
 236            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 237
 238        Returns
 239        -------
 240        separated_field : list of numpy.ndarray
 241            The separated representation. Every array is of shape : 
 242            (field, shape, ..., nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`)
 243        """
 244        field_shape = unpacked_field.shape[:-1]
 245        separated_field = []
 246        ind = 0
 247        for patch_shape in self.shape_by_patch:
 248            next_ind = ind + np.prod(patch_shape)
 249            separated_field.append(unpacked_field[..., ind:next_ind].reshape((*field_shape, *patch_shape)))
 250            ind = next_ind
 251        return separated_field
 252    
 253    def agglomerate(self, separated_field):
 254        """
 255        Extract the unpacked representation from a separated representation.
 256
 257        Parameters
 258        ----------
 259        separated_field : list of numpy.ndarray
 260            The separated representation. Every array is of shape : 
 261            (field, shape, ..., nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`)
 262
 263        Returns
 264        -------
 265        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
 266            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
 267            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 268        """
 269        field_shape = separated_field[0].shape[:-self.npa]
 270        assert np.all([f.shape[:-self.npa]==field_shape for f in separated_field]), "Every patch must have the same field shape !"
 271        unpacked_field = np.concatenate([f.reshape((*field_shape, -1)) for f in separated_field], axis=-1)
 272        return unpacked_field
 273    
 274    def unique_field_indices(self, field_shape, representation="separated"):
 275        """
 276        Get the unique, unpacked or separated representation of a field's unique indices.
 277
 278        Parameters
 279        ----------
 280        field_shape : tuple of int
 281            The shape of the field. For example, if it is a vector field, `field_shape` 
 282            should be (3,). If it is a second order tensor field, it should be (3, 3).
 283        representation : str, optional
 284            The user must choose between `"unique"`, `"unpacked"`, and `"separated"`.
 285            It corresponds to the type of representation to get, by default "separated"
 286
 287        Returns
 288        -------
 289        unique_field_indices : numpy.ndarray of int or list of numpy.ndarray of int
 290            The unique, unpacked or separated representation of a field's unique indices.
 291            If unique, its shape is (*`field_shape`, `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`).
 292            If unpacked, its shape is : (*`field_shape`, `self`.`nb_nodes`).
 293            If separated, every array is of shape : (*`field_shape`, nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`).
 294        """
 295        nb_indices = np.prod(field_shape)*self.nb_unique_nodes
 296        unique_field_indices_as_unique_field = np.arange(nb_indices, dtype='int').reshape((*field_shape, self.nb_unique_nodes))
 297        if representation=="unique":
 298            unique_field_indices = unique_field_indices_as_unique_field
 299            return unique_field_indices
 300        elif representation=="unpacked":
 301            unique_field_indices = self.unpack(unique_field_indices_as_unique_field)
 302            return unique_field_indices
 303        elif representation=="separated":
 304            unique_field_indices = self.separate(self.unpack(unique_field_indices_as_unique_field))
 305            return unique_field_indices
 306        else:
 307            raise ValueError(f'Representation "{representation}" not recognised. Representation must either be "unique", "unpacked", or "separated" !')
 308    
 309    def get_duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask(self):
 310        """
 311        Returns a boolean mask indicating which nodes in the unpacked representation are duplicates.
 312
 313        Returns
 314        -------
 315        duplicate_nodes_mask : numpy.ndarray
 316            Boolean mask of shape (nb_nodes,) where True indicates a node is duplicated 
 317            across multiple patches and False indicates it appears only once.
 318        """
 319        _, inverse, counts = np.unique(self.unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True, return_counts=True)
 320        duplicate_nodes_mask = counts[inverse]>1
 321        return duplicate_nodes_mask
 322    
 323    def extract_exterior_borders(self, splines):
 324        """
 325        Extract exterior borders from B-spline patches.
 326
 327        Parameters
 328        ----------
 329        splines : list[BSpline]
 330            Array of B-spline patches to extract borders from.
 331
 332        Returns
 333        -------
 334        border_connectivity : MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 335            Connectivity information for the border patches.
 336        border_splines : list[BSpline]
 337            Array of B-spline patches representing the borders.
 338        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity : numpy.ndarray of int
 339            Array mapping border unique nodes to original unique nodes.
 340
 341        Raises
 342        ------
 343        AssertionError
 344            If isoparametric space dimension is less than 2.
 345        """
 346        if self.npa<=1:
 347            raise AssertionError("The parametric space must be at least 2D to extract borders !")
 348        duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask = self.get_duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask()
 349        duplicate_separated_nodes_mask = self.separate(duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask)
 350        separated_unique_nodes_inds = self.unique_field_indices(())
 351        arr = np.arange(self.npa).tolist()
 352        border_splines = []
 353        border_unique_nodes_inds = []
 354        border_shape_by_patch = []
 355        for i in range(self.nb_patchs):
 356            spline = splines[i]
 357            duplicate_nodes_mask_spline = duplicate_separated_nodes_mask[i]
 358            unique_nodes_inds_spline = separated_unique_nodes_inds[i]
 359            shape_by_patch_spline = self.shape_by_patch[i]
 360            for axis in range(self.npa):
 361                bases = np.hstack((spline.bases[(axis + 1):], spline.bases[:axis]))
 362                axes = arr[axis:-1] + arr[:axis]
 363                border_shape_by_patch_spline = np.hstack((shape_by_patch_spline[(axis + 1):], shape_by_patch_spline[:axis]))
 364                if not np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, 0, axis=axis).all():
 365                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases[::-1])
 366                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 367                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, 0, axis=axis).transpose(axes[::-1]).ravel()
 368                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 369                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[::-1][None]
 370                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 371                    # print(f"side {0} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 372                if not np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, -1, axis=axis).all():
 373                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases)
 374                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 375                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, -1, axis=axis).transpose(axes).ravel()
 376                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 377                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[None]
 378                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 379                    # print(f"side {-1} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 380        border_splines = np.array(border_splines, dtype='object')
 381        border_unique_nodes_inds = np.concatenate(border_unique_nodes_inds)
 382        border_shape_by_patch = np.concatenate(border_shape_by_patch)
 383        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity, inverse = np.unique(border_unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True)
 384        border_unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity))) - 1)[inverse]
 385        border_nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(border_unique_nodes_inds).size
 386        border_connectivity = self.__class__(border_unique_nodes_inds, border_shape_by_patch, border_nb_unique_nodes)
 387        return border_connectivity, border_splines, border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity
 388    
 389    def extract_interior_borders(self, splines):
 390        """
 391        Extract interior borders from B-spline patches where nodes are shared between patches.
 392
 393        Parameters
 394        ----------
 395        splines : list[BSpline]
 396            Array of B-spline patches to extract borders from.
 397
 398        Returns
 399        -------
 400        border_connectivity : MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 401            Connectivity information for the border patches.
 402        border_splines : list[BSpline]
 403            Array of B-spline patches representing the borders.
 404        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity : numpy.ndarray of int
 405            Array mapping border unique nodes to original unique nodes.
 406
 407        Raises
 408        ------
 409        AssertionError
 410            If parametric space dimension is less than 2.
 411        """
 412        if self.npa<=1:
 413            raise AssertionError("The parametric space must be at least 2D to extract borders !")
 414        duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask = self.get_duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask()
 415        duplicate_separated_nodes_mask = self.separate(duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask)
 416        separated_unique_nodes_inds = self.unique_field_indices(())
 417        arr = np.arange(self.npa).tolist()
 418        border_splines = []
 419        border_unique_nodes_inds = []
 420        border_shape_by_patch = []
 421        for i in range(self.nb_patchs):
 422            spline = splines[i]
 423            duplicate_nodes_mask_spline = duplicate_separated_nodes_mask[i]
 424            unique_nodes_inds_spline = separated_unique_nodes_inds[i]
 425            shape_by_patch_spline = self.shape_by_patch[i]
 426            for axis in range(self.npa):
 427                bases = np.hstack((spline.bases[(axis + 1):], spline.bases[:axis]))
 428                axes = arr[axis:-1] + arr[:axis]
 429                border_shape_by_patch_spline = np.hstack((shape_by_patch_spline[(axis + 1):], shape_by_patch_spline[:axis]))
 430                if np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, 0, axis=axis).all():
 431                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases[::-1])
 432                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 433                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, 0, axis=axis).transpose(axes[::-1]).ravel()
 434                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 435                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[::-1][None]
 436                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 437                    # print(f"side {0} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 438                if np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, -1, axis=axis).all():
 439                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases)
 440                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 441                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, -1, axis=axis).transpose(axes).ravel()
 442                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 443                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[None]
 444                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 445                    # print(f"side {-1} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 446        border_splines = np.array(border_splines, dtype='object')
 447        border_unique_nodes_inds = np.concatenate(border_unique_nodes_inds)
 448        border_shape_by_patch = np.concatenate(border_shape_by_patch)
 449        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity, inverse = np.unique(border_unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True)
 450        border_unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity))) - 1)[inverse]
 451        border_nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(border_unique_nodes_inds).size
 452        border_connectivity = self.__class__(border_unique_nodes_inds, border_shape_by_patch, border_nb_unique_nodes)
 453        return border_connectivity, border_splines, border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity
 454

 533    
 534    def subset(self, splines, patches_to_keep):
 535        """
 536        Create a subset of the multi-patch B-spline connectivity by keeping only selected patches.
 537
 538        Parameters
 539        ----------
 540        splines : list[BSpline]
 541            Array of B-spline patches to subset.
 542        patches_to_keep : numpy.array of int
 543            Indices of patches to keep in the subset.
 544
 545        Returns
 546        -------
 547        new_connectivity : MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 548            New connectivity object containing only the selected patches.
 549        new_splines : list[BSpline]
 550            Array of B-spline patches for the selected patches.
 551        new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity : numpy.ndarray of int
 552            Array mapping new unique nodes to original unique nodes.
 553        """
 554        new_splines = splines[patches_to_keep]
 555        separated_unique_nodes_inds = self.unique_field_indices(())
 556        new_unique_nodes_inds = np.concatenate([separated_unique_nodes_inds[patch].flat for patch in patches_to_keep])
 557        new_shape_by_patch = self.shape_by_patch[patches_to_keep]
 558        new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity, inverse = np.unique(new_unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True)
 559        new_unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity))) - 1)[inverse]
 560        new_nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(new_unique_nodes_inds).size
 561        new_connectivity = self.__class__(new_unique_nodes_inds, new_shape_by_patch, new_nb_unique_nodes)
 562        return new_connectivity, new_splines, new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity
 563    
 564    def make_control_poly_meshes(
 565        self, 
 566        splines: Iterable[BSpline], 
 567        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]], 
 568        n_eval_per_elem: Union[Iterable[int], int]=10, 
 569        n_step: int=1, 
 570        unique_fields: dict={}, 
 571        separated_fields: Union[dict, None]=None, 
 572        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]]=None, 
 573        paraview_sizes: dict={}
 574        ) -> list[io.Mesh]:
 575        
 576        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 577            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem]*self.npa
 578        
 579        if separated_fields is None:
 580            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 581        
 582        if XI_list is None:
 583            XI_list = [None]*self.nb_patchs
 584        
 585        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 586            if callable(value):
 587                raise NotImplementedError("To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !")
 588            else:
 589                if value.shape[-1]!=self.nb_unique_nodes:
 590                    raise ValueError(f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format).")
 591                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 592                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 593                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 594        
 595        step_meshes = np.empty((self.nb_patchs, n_step), dtype=object)
 596        for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 597            step_meshes[patch] = splines[patch].make_control_poly_meshes(separated_ctrl_pts[patch], 
 598                                                                         n_eval_per_elem=n_eval_per_elem, 
 599                                                                         n_step=n_step, 
 600                                                                         fields=separated_fields[patch], 
 601                                                                         XI=XI_list[patch], 
 602                                                                         paraview_sizes=paraview_sizes)
 603            for mesh in step_meshes[patch]:
 604                mesh.point_data["patch_id"] = np.full(mesh.points.shape[0], patch, dtype=int)
 605        meshes = []
 606        for time_step_meshes in step_meshes.T:
 607            meshes.append(merge_meshes(time_step_meshes))
 608        return meshes
 609    
 610    def make_elem_separator_meshes(
 611        self, 
 612        splines: Iterable[BSpline], 
 613        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]], 
 614        n_eval_per_elem: Union[Iterable[int], int]=10, 
 615        n_step: int=1, 
 616        unique_fields: dict={}, 
 617        separated_fields: Union[dict, None]=None, 
 618        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]]=None, 
 619        paraview_sizes: dict={}, 
 620        parallel: bool=True, 
 621        verbose: bool=True
 622        ) -> list[io.Mesh]:
 623        
 624        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 625            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem]*self.npa
 626        
 627        if separated_fields is None:
 628            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 629        
 630        if XI_list is None:
 631            XI_list = [None]*self.nb_patchs
 632        
 633        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 634            if callable(value):
 635                raise NotImplementedError("To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !")
 636            else:
 637                if value.shape[-1]!=self.nb_unique_nodes:
 638                    raise ValueError(f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format).")
 639                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 640                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 641                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 642        
 643        funcs = [splines[i].make_elem_separator_meshes for i in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 644        all_args = [(separated_ctrl_pts[i], n_eval_per_elem, n_step, separated_fields[i], XI_list[i], paraview_sizes) for i in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 645        
 646        elem_separator_meshes = parallel_blocks(funcs, all_args, verbose=verbose, pbar_title="Making elements separators meshes", disable_parallel=not parallel)
 647        
 648        for patch, step_meshes in enumerate(elem_separator_meshes):
 649            for timestep, mesh in enumerate(step_meshes):
 650                mesh.point_data["patch_id"] = np.full(mesh.points.shape[0], patch, dtype=int)
 651        meshes = []
 652        for timestep, patch_meshes in enumerate(zip(*elem_separator_meshes)):
 653            meshes.append(merge_meshes(patch_meshes))
 654        
 655        return meshes
 656    
 657    def make_elements_interior_meshes(self, 
 658                                      splines: Iterable[BSpline], 
 659                                      separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]], 
 660                                      n_eval_per_elem: Union[Iterable[int], int]=10, 
 661                                      n_step: int=1, 
 662                                      unique_fields: dict={}, 
 663                                      separated_fields: Union[dict, None]=None, 
 664                                      XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]]=None, 
 665                                      parallel: bool=True, 
 666                                      verbose: bool=True) -> list[io.Mesh]:
 667        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 668            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem]*self.npa
 669        
 670        if separated_fields is None:
 671            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 672        
 673        if XI_list is None:
 674            XI_list = [None]*self.nb_patchs
 675        
 676        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 677            if callable(value):
 678                raise NotImplementedError("To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !")
 679            else:
 680                if value.shape[-1]!=self.nb_unique_nodes:
 681                    raise ValueError(f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format).")
 682                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 683                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 684                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 685        
 686        funcs = [splines[i].make_elements_interior_meshes for i in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 687        all_args = [(separated_ctrl_pts[i], n_eval_per_elem, n_step, separated_fields[i], XI_list[i]) for i in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 688        
 689        interior_meshes = parallel_blocks(funcs, all_args, verbose=verbose, pbar_title="Making interior meshes", disable_parallel=not parallel)
 690        
 691        for patch, step_meshes in enumerate(interior_meshes):
 692            for timestep, mesh in enumerate(step_meshes):
 693                mesh.point_data["patch_id"] = np.full(mesh.points.shape[0], patch, dtype=int)
 694        meshes = []
 695        for timestep, patch_meshes in enumerate(zip(*interior_meshes)):
 696            meshes.append(merge_meshes(patch_meshes))
 697        
 698        return meshes
 699    
 700    def make_all_meshes(
 701        self, 
 702        splines: Iterable[BSpline], 
 703        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]], 
 704        n_step: int=1, 
 705        n_eval_per_elem: Union[int, Iterable[int]]=10, 
 706        unique_fields: dict={}, 
 707        separated_fields: Union[list[dict], None]=None, 
 708        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]]=None, 
 709        verbose: bool=True, 
 710        fields_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal['auto'], list[str]]='auto'
 711        ) -> tuple[list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh]]:
 712        """
 713        Generate all mesh representations (interior, element borders, and control points) for a multipatch B-spline geometry.
 714
 715        This method creates three types of meshes for visualization or analysis:
 716        - The interior mesh representing the B-spline surface or volume.
 717        - The element separator mesh showing the borders between elements.
 718        - The control polygon mesh showing the control structure.
 719
 720        Parameters
 721        ----------
 722        splines : Iterable[BSpline]
 723            List of B-spline patches to process.
 724        separated_ctrl_pts : Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]]
 725            Control points for each patch in separated representation.
 726        n_step : int, optional
 727            Number of time steps to generate. By default, 1.
 728        n_eval_per_elem : Union[int, Iterable[int]], optional
 729            Number of evaluation points per element for each isoparametric dimension.
 730            If an `int` is provided, the same number is used for all dimensions.
 731            If an `Iterable` is provided, each value corresponds to a different dimension.
 732            By default, 10.
 733        unique_fields : dict, optional
 734            Fields in unique representation to visualize. By default, `{}`.
 735            Keys are field names, values are arrays (not callables nor FE fields).
 736        separated_fields : Union[list[dict], None], optional
 737            Fields to visualize at each time step.
 738            List of `self.nb_patchs` dictionaries (one per patch) of format:
 739            {
 740                "field_name": `field_value`
 741            }
 742            where `field_value` can be either:
 743            1. A `np.ndarray` with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `self.shape_by_patch[patch]`)
 744            2. A `np.ndarray` with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `*grid_shape`)
 745            3. A function that computes field values (`np.ndarray[np.floating]`) at given points from the `BSpline` instance and `XI`.
 746            By default, None.
 747        XI_list : Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]], optional
 748            Parametric coordinates at which to evaluate the B-spline patches and fields.
 749            If not `None`, overrides the `n_eval_per_elem` parameter.
 750            If `None`, regular grids are generated according to `n_eval_per_elem`.
 751            By default, None.
 752        verbose : bool, optional
 753            Whether to print progress information. By default, True.
 754        fiels_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal['auto'], list[str]], optionnal
 755            Whether to include fields only on the interior mesh (`True`), on all meshes (`False`),
 756            or on specified field names.
 757            If set to `'auto'`, fields named `'u'`, `'U'`, `'displacement'` or `'displ'` 
 758            are included on all meshes while others are only included on the interior mesh.
 759            By default, 'auto'.
 760
 761        Returns
 762        -------
 763        tuple[list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh]]
 764            Tuple containing three lists of `io.Mesh` objects:
 765            - Interior meshes for each time step.
 766            - Element separator meshes for each time step.
 767            - Control polygon meshes for each time step.
 768
 769        Raises
 770        ------
 771        NotImplementedError
 772            If a callable is passed in `unique_fields`.
 773        ValueError
 774            If a field in `unique_fields` does not have the correct shape.
 775
 776        Notes
 777        -----
 778        - The isoparametric space refers to the parametric space of the B-splines.
 779        - Fields can be visualized as scalars or vectors.
 780        - Supports time-dependent visualization through `n_step`.
 781        - Fields in `unique_fields` must be arrays; to use callables, use `separated_fields`.
 782
 783        Examples
 784        --------
 785        >>> interior, borders, control = connectivity.make_all_meshes(splines, separated_ctrl_pts)
 786        """
 787        
 788        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 789            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem]*self.npa
 790        
 791        if separated_fields is None:
 792            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 793        
 794        if XI_list is None:
 795            XI_list = [None]*self.nb_patchs
 796        
 797        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 798            if callable(value):
 799                raise NotImplementedError("To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !")
 800            else:
 801                if value.shape[-1]!=self.nb_unique_nodes:
 802                    raise ValueError(f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format).")
 803                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 804                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 805                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 806        
 807        paraview_sizes = {}
 808        fields = separated_fields[0]
 809        if fields_on_interior_only is True:
 810            for key, value in fields.items():
 811                if callable(value):
 812                    paraview_sizes[key] = value(splines[0], np.zeros((splines[0].NPa, 1))).shape[2]
 813                else:
 814                    paraview_sizes[key] = value.shape[1]
 815        elif fields_on_interior_only is False:
 816            pass
 817        elif fields_on_interior_only=='auto':
 818            for key, value in fields.items():
 819                if key not in ['u', 'U', 'displacement', 'displ']:
 820                    if callable(value):
 821                        paraview_sizes[key] = value(splines[0], np.zeros((splines[0].NPa, 1))).shape[2]
 822                    else:
 823                        paraview_sizes[key] = value.shape[1]
 824        else:
 825            for key in fields_on_interior_only:
 826                value = fields[key]
 827                if callable(value):
 828                    paraview_sizes[key] = value(splines[0], np.zeros((splines[0].NPa, 1))).shape[2]
 829                else:
 830                    paraview_sizes[key] = value.shape[1]
 831                
 832        
 833        elem_interior_meshes = self.make_elements_interior_meshes(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, n_eval_per_elem, n_step, separated_fields=separated_fields, XI_list=XI_list, verbose=verbose)
 834        if verbose:
 835            print("interior done")
 836
 837        elem_separator_meshes = self.make_elem_separator_meshes(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, n_eval_per_elem, n_step, separated_fields=separated_fields, XI_list=XI_list, paraview_sizes=paraview_sizes)
 838        if verbose:
 839            print("elements borders done")
 840
 841        control_poly_meshes = self.make_control_poly_meshes(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, n_eval_per_elem, n_step, separated_fields=separated_fields, XI_list=XI_list, paraview_sizes=paraview_sizes)
 842        if verbose:
 843            print("control points done")
 844        
 845        return elem_interior_meshes, elem_separator_meshes, control_poly_meshes
 846        
 847    def save_paraview(
 848        self, 
 849        splines: Iterable[BSpline], 
 850        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]], 
 851        path: str, 
 852        name: str, 
 853        n_step: int=1, 
 854        n_eval_per_elem: Union[int, Iterable[int]]=10, 
 855        unique_fields: dict={}, 
 856        separated_fields: Union[list[dict], None]=None, 
 857        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]]=None, 
 858        groups: Union[dict[str, dict[str, Union[str, int]]], None]=None, 
 859        make_pvd: bool=True, 
 860        verbose: bool=True, 
 861        fields_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal['auto'], list[str]]='auto'):
 862        """
 863        Save multipatch B-spline visualization data as Paraview files.
 864
 865        This method generates three types of visualization files for a multipatch B-spline geometry:
 866        - Interior mesh showing the B-spline surface/volume
 867        - Element borders showing the mesh structure
 868        - Control points mesh showing the control structure
 869
 870        All files are saved in VTU format, with an optional PVD file to group them for Paraview.
 871
 872        Parameters
 873        ----------
 874        splines : Iterable[BSpline]
 875            List of B-spline patches to save.
 876        separated_ctrl_pts : Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]]
 877            Control points for each patch in separated representation.
 878        path : str
 879            Directory path where the files will be saved.
 880        name : str
 881            Base name for the output files.
 882        n_step : int, optional
 883            Number of time steps to save. By default, 1.
 884        n_eval_per_elem : Union[int, Iterable[int]], optional
 885            Number of evaluation points per element for each isoparametric dimension.
 886            If an `int` is provided, the same number is used for all dimensions.
 887            If an `Iterable` is provided, each value corresponds to a different dimension.
 888            By default, 10.
 889        unique_fields : dict, optional
 890            Fields in unique representation to save. By default, `{}`.
 891            Keys are field names, values are arrays (not callables nor FE fields).
 892        separated_fields : Union[list[dict], None], optional
 893            Fields to visualize at each time step.
 894            List of `self.nb_patchs` dictionaries (one per patch) of format:
 895            {
 896                "field_name": `field_value`
 897            }
 898            where `field_value` can be either:
 899            
 900            1. A numpy array with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `self.shape_by_patch[patch]`) where:
 901            - `n_step`: Number of time steps
 902            - `field_size`: Size of the field at each point (1 for scalar, 3 for vector)
 903            - `self.shape_by_patch[patch]`: Same shape as the patch's control points grid (excluding `NPh`)
 904            
 905            2. A numpy array with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `*grid_shape`) where:
 906            - `n_step`: Number of time steps
 907            - `field_size`: Size of the field at each point (1 for scalar, 3 for vector)
 908            - `*grid_shape`: Shape of the evaluation grid (number of points along each isoparametric axis)
 909            
 910            3. A function that computes field values (`np.ndarray[np.floating]`) at given 
 911            points from the `BSpline` instance and `XI`, the tuple of arrays containing evaluation 
 912            points for each dimension (`tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]`).
 913            The result should be an array of shape (`n_step`, `n_points`, `field_size`) where:
 914            - `n_step`: Number of time steps
 915            - `n_points`: Number of evaluation points (n_xi × n_eta × ...)
 916            - `field_size`: Size of the field at each point (1 for scalar, 3 for vector)
 917            
 918            By default, None.
 919        XI_list : Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]], optional
 920            Parametric coordinates at which to evaluate the B-spline patches and fields.
 921            If not `None`, overrides the `n_eval_per_elem` parameter.
 922            If `None`, regular grids are generated according to `n_eval_per_elem`.
 923        groups : Union[dict[str, dict[str, Union[str, int]]], None], optional
 924            Nested dictionary specifying file groups for PVD organization. Format:
 925            {
 926                "group_name": {
 927                    "ext": str,     # File extension (e.g., "vtu")
 928                    "npart": int,   # Number of parts in the group
 929                    "nstep": int    # Number of timesteps
 930                }
 931            }
 932            If provided, existing groups are updated; if `None`, groups are created automatically.
 933            By default, `None`.
 934        make_pvd : bool, optional
 935            Whether to create a PVD file grouping all VTU files. By default, `True`.
 936        verbose : bool, optional
 937            Whether to print progress information. By default, `True`.
 938        fields_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal['auto'], list[str]], optionnal
 939            Whether to include fields only on the interior mesh (`True`), on all meshes (`False`),
 940            or on specified field names.
 941            If set to `'auto'`, fields named `'u'`, `'U'`, `'displacement'` or `'displ'` 
 942            are included on all meshes while others are only included on the interior mesh.
 943            By default, 'auto'.
 944
 945        Returns
 946        -------
 947        groups : dict[str, dict[str, Union[str, int]]]
 948            Updated groups dictionary with information about saved files.
 949
 950        Raises
 951        ------
 952        NotImplementedError
 953            If a callable is passed in `unique_fields`.
 954        ValueError
 955            If the multiprocessing pool is not running and cannot be restarted.
 956
 957        Notes
 958        -----
 959        - Creates three types of VTU files for each time step:
 960            - {name}_interior_{part}_{step}.vtu
 961            - {name}_elements_borders_{part}_{step}.vtu
 962            - {name}_control_points_{part}_{step}.vtu
 963        - If `make_pvd=True`, creates a PVD file named {name}.pvd.
 964        - Fields can be visualized as scalars or vectors in Paraview.
 965        - The method supports time-dependent visualization through `n_step`.
 966        - Fields in `unique_fields` must be arrays; to use callables, use `separated_fields`.
 967
 968        Examples
 969        --------
 970        Save a multipatch B-spline visualization:
 971        >>> connectivity.save_paraview(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, "./output", "multipatch")
 972
 973        Save with a custom separated field on a 2 patches multipatch:
 974        >>> fields = [{"temperature": np.random.rand(1, 4, 4)}, {"temperature": np.random.rand(1, 7, 3)}]
 975        >>> connectivity.save_paraview(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, "./output", "multipatch", separated_fields=fields)
 976        """
 977        
 978        if groups is None:
 979            groups = {}
 980        
 981        interior = "interior"
 982        if interior in groups:
 983            groups[interior]["npart"] += 1
 984        else:
 985            groups[interior] = {"ext": "vtu", "npart": 1, "nstep": n_step}
 986        elements_borders = "elements_borders"
 987        if elements_borders in groups:
 988            groups[elements_borders]["npart"] += 1
 989        else:
 990            groups[elements_borders] = {"ext": "vtu", "npart": 1, "nstep": n_step}
 991        control_points = "control_points"
 992        if control_points in groups:
 993            groups[control_points]["npart"] += 1
 994        else:
 995            groups[control_points] = {"ext": "vtu", "npart": 1, "nstep": n_step}
 996        
 997        elem_interior_meshes, elem_separator_meshes, control_poly_meshes = self.make_all_meshes(
 998            splines, 
 999            separated_ctrl_pts, 
1000            n_step, 
1001            n_eval_per_elem, 
1002            unique_fields, 
1003            separated_fields, 
1004            XI_list, 
1005            verbose, 
1006            fields_on_interior_only
1007        )
1008        
1009        prefix = os.path.join(path, f"{name}_{interior}_{groups[interior]['npart'] - 1}")
1010        for time_step, mesh in enumerate(elem_interior_meshes):
1011            mesh.write(f"{prefix}_{time_step}.vtu")
1012        if verbose:
1013            print(interior, "saved")
1014
1015        prefix = os.path.join(path, f"{name}_{elements_borders}_{groups[elements_borders]['npart'] - 1}")
1016        for time_step, mesh in enumerate(elem_separator_meshes):
1017            mesh.write(f"{prefix}_{time_step}.vtu")
1018        if verbose:
1019            print(elements_borders, "saved")
1020
1021        prefix = os.path.join(path, f"{name}_{control_points}_{groups[control_points]['npart'] - 1}")
1022        for time_step, mesh in enumerate(control_poly_meshes):
1023            mesh.write(f"{prefix}_{time_step}.vtu")
1024        if verbose:
1025            print(control_points, "saved")
1026        
1027        if make_pvd:
1028            writePVD(os.path.join(path, name), groups)
1029        
1030        return groups

Contains all the methods to link multiple B-spline patches. It uses 3 representations of the data :

  • a unique representation, possibly common with other meshes, containing only unique nodes indices,
  • a unpacked representation containing duplicated nodes indices,
  • a separated representation containing duplicated nodes indices, separated between patches. It is here for user friendliness.
Attributes
  • unique_nodes_inds (numpy.ndarray of int): The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  • shape_by_patch (numpy.ndarray of int): The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  • nb_nodes (int): The total number of unpacked nodes.
  • nb_unique_nodes (int): The total number of unique nodes.
  • nb_patchs (int): The number of patches.
  • npa (int): The dimension of the parametric space of the B-splines.
MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity(unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes) 
82    def __init__(self, unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes):
83        """
84
85        Parameters
86        ----------
87        unique_nodes_inds : numpy.ndarray of int
88            The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
89        shape_by_patch : numpy.ndarray of int
90            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
91        nb_unique_nodes : int
92            The total number of unique nodes.
93        """
94        self.unique_nodes_inds = unique_nodes_inds
95        self.shape_by_patch = shape_by_patch
96        self.nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(self.shape_by_patch, axis=1))
97        self.nb_unique_nodes = nb_unique_nodes #np.unique(self.unique_nodes_inds).size
98        self.nb_patchs, self.npa = self.shape_by_patch.shape
Parameters
  • unique_nodes_inds (numpy.ndarray of int): The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  • shape_by_patch (numpy.ndarray of int): The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  • nb_unique_nodes (int): The total number of unique nodes.

@classmethod
def from_nodes_couples(cls, nodes_couples, shape_by_patch): 
100    @classmethod
101    def from_nodes_couples(cls, nodes_couples, shape_by_patch):
102        """
103        Create the connectivity from a list of couples of unpacked nodes.
104
105        Parameters
106        ----------
107        nodes_couples : numpy.ndarray of int
108            Couples of indices of unpacked nodes that are considered the same.
109            Its shape should be (# of couples, 2)
110        shape_by_patch : numpy.ndarray of int
111            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
112
113        Returns
114        -------
115        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
116            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
117        """
118        nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(shape_by_patch, axis=1))
119        unique_nodes_inds = get_unique_nodes_inds(nodes_couples, nb_nodes)
120        different_unique_nodes_inds, inverse = np.unique(unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True)
121        unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], different_unique_nodes_inds))) - 1)[inverse]
122        nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(unique_nodes_inds).size
123        return cls(unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes)

Create the connectivity from a list of couples of unpacked nodes.

Parameters
  • nodes_couples (numpy.ndarray of int): Couples of indices of unpacked nodes that are considered the same. Its shape should be (# of couples, 2)
  • shape_by_patch (numpy.ndarray of int): The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
Returns
  • MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity: Instance of MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity created.
@classmethod
def from_separated_ctrlPts( cls, separated_ctrlPts, eps=1e-10, return_nodes_couples: bool = False): 
125    @classmethod
126    def from_separated_ctrlPts(cls, separated_ctrlPts, eps=1e-10, return_nodes_couples: bool=False):
127        """
128        Create the connectivity from a list of control points given as 
129        a separated field by comparing every couple of points.
130
131        Parameters
132        ----------
133        separated_ctrlPts : list of numpy.ndarray of float
134            Control points of every patch to be compared in the separated 
135            representation. Every array is of shape : 
136            (``NPh``, nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim ``npa``)
137        eps : float, optional
138            Maximum distance between two points to be considered the same, by default 1e-10
139        return_nodes_couples : bool, optional
140            If `True`, returns the `nodes_couples` created, by default False
141
142        Returns
143        -------
144        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
145            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
146        """
147        NPh = separated_ctrlPts[0].shape[0]
148        assert np.all([ctrlPts.shape[0]==NPh for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts[1:]]), "Physical spaces must contain the same number of dimensions !"
149        shape_by_patch = np.array([ctrlPts.shape[1:] for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts], dtype='int')
150        nodes_couples = []
151        previous_pts = separated_ctrlPts[0].reshape((NPh, -1))
152        previous_inds_counter = previous_pts.shape[1]
153        previous_inds = np.arange(previous_inds_counter)
154        for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts[1:]:
155            # create current pts and inds
156            current_pts = ctrlPts.reshape((NPh, -1))
157            current_inds_counter = previous_inds_counter + current_pts.shape[1]
158            current_inds = np.arange(previous_inds_counter, current_inds_counter)
159            # get couples
160            dist = np.linalg.norm(previous_pts[:, :, None] - current_pts[:, None, :], axis=0)
161            previous_inds_inds, current_inds_inds = (dist<eps).nonzero()
162            nodes_couples.append(np.hstack((previous_inds[previous_inds_inds, None], current_inds[current_inds_inds, None])))
163            # add current to previous for next iteration
164            previous_pts = np.hstack((previous_pts, current_pts))
165            previous_inds_counter = current_inds_counter
166            previous_inds = np.hstack((previous_inds, current_inds))
167        if len(nodes_couples)>0:
168            nodes_couples = np.vstack(nodes_couples)
169        else:
170            nodes_couples = np.empty((0, 2), dtype='int')
171        if return_nodes_couples:
172            return cls.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch), nodes_couples
173        else:
174            return cls.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch)

Create the connectivity from a list of control points given as a separated field by comparing every couple of points.

Parameters
  • separated_ctrlPts (list of numpy.ndarray of float): Control points of every patch to be compared in the separated representation. Every array is of shape : (NPh, nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim npa)
  • eps (float, optional): Maximum distance between two points to be considered the same, by default 1e-10
  • return_nodes_couples (bool, optional): If True, returns the nodes_couples created, by default False
Returns
  • MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity: Instance of MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity created.

Extract the unpacked representation from a unique representation.

def pack(self, unpacked_field, method='mean'): 
195    def pack(self, unpacked_field, method='mean'):
196        """
197        Extract the unique representation from an unpacked representation.
198
199        Parameters
200        ----------
201        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
202            The unpacked representation. Its shape should be :
203            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
204        method: str
205            The method used to group values that could be different
206
207        Returns
208        -------
209        unique_nodes : numpy.ndarray
210            The unique representation. Its shape is :
211            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`)
212        """
213        field_shape = unpacked_field.shape[:-1]
214        unique_field = np.zeros((*field_shape, self.nb_unique_nodes), dtype=unpacked_field.dtype)
215        if method=='last':
216            unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds] = unpacked_field
217        elif method=='first':
218            unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds[::-1]] = unpacked_field[..., ::-1]
219        elif method=='mean':
220            np.add.at(unique_field.T, self.unique_nodes_inds, unpacked_field.T)
221            counts = np.zeros(self.nb_unique_nodes, dtype='uint')
222            np.add.at(counts, self.unique_nodes_inds, 1)
223            unique_field /= counts
224        else:
225            raise NotImplementedError(f"Method {method} is not implemented ! Consider using 'first' or 'mean'.")
226        return unique_field

Extract the unique representation from an unpacked representation.

Parameters
  • unpacked_field (numpy.ndarray): The unpacked representation. Its shape should be : (field, shape, ..., self.nb_nodes)
  • method (str): The method used to group values that could be different
Returns
  • unique_nodes (numpy.ndarray): The unique representation. Its shape is : (field, shape, ..., self.nb_unique_nodes)
def separate(self, unpacked_field): 
228    def separate(self, unpacked_field):
229        """
230        Extract the separated representation from an unpacked representation.
231
232        Parameters
233        ----------
234        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
235            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
236            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
237
238        Returns
239        -------
240        separated_field : list of numpy.ndarray
241            The separated representation. Every array is of shape : 
242            (field, shape, ..., nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`)
243        """
244        field_shape = unpacked_field.shape[:-1]
245        separated_field = []
246        ind = 0
247        for patch_shape in self.shape_by_patch:
248            next_ind = ind + np.prod(patch_shape)
249            separated_field.append(unpacked_field[..., ind:next_ind].reshape((*field_shape, *patch_shape)))
250            ind = next_ind
251        return separated_field

def agglomerate(self, separated_field): 
253    def agglomerate(self, separated_field):
254        """
255        Extract the unpacked representation from a separated representation.
256
257        Parameters
258        ----------
259        separated_field : list of numpy.ndarray
260            The separated representation. Every array is of shape : 
261            (field, shape, ..., nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`)
262
263        Returns
264        -------
265        unpacked_field : numpy.ndarray
266            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
267            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
268        """
269        field_shape = separated_field[0].shape[:-self.npa]
270        assert np.all([f.shape[:-self.npa]==field_shape for f in separated_field]), "Every patch must have the same field shape !"
271        unpacked_field = np.concatenate([f.reshape((*field_shape, -1)) for f in separated_field], axis=-1)
272        return unpacked_field

Extract the unpacked representation from a separated representation.
